subSubSection.paragraph:
Siculodes ( Zeuzerodes ) cervinalis
Pagenstecher, 1892
. Deutsche entomologische Zeitschrift. “Iris” 5 : 82; 2 females [ recte 1 male and 1 female ] [ syntypes ], Chanchamayo , [ Junín ], South of Peru , Staudinger collection, [MfN].

Rhodoneura cervinalis ;
Hampson, 1897 . Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London, 1897 (1): 616.

Loxiorhiza cervinalis ;
Warren, 1904 . Novitates Zoologicae, 11 (1): 494.— Dalla Torre, 1914 . Lepidopterorum Catalogus 20 : 37.— Gaede, 1936 , in Seitz. Die Gross -Schmetterlinge des Amerikanischen Faunengebietes. Die amerikanischen Spinner und Schwärmer 6 : 1204, fig. 180h (d).— Whalley, 1964 . Annals and Magazine of Natural History, (13) 7 (74): 122.— Whalley & Heppner, 1995 , Thyridoidea, in Becker et al. Checklist: Part 2, Hyblaeoidea–Pyraloidea–Tortricoidea , in Heppner (ed.). Atlas of Neotropical Lepidoptera 3 : 32.

Taxonomic history . Pagenstecher (1892) described the species, without illustration, based on two females [ syntypes ] from Chanchamayo, [ Junín ], Peru . The species was allocated to the subgenus Zeuzerodes , but this combination was not followed by subsequent authors. Finally, the species was transferred by Hampson (1897) to
Rhodoneura
and then by Warren (1904) to
Loxiorhiza
.

Type material . Pagenstecher (1892) described the species based on two females from Chanchamayo, [ Junín ], Peru . The description alluded to the alar morphology and a tuft of setae on the inner margin of the hindwing, exclusive in males, which indicates that the description was based on the male as well. Two syntypes were found in the MfN . To give stability to the proposed name and ensure the correct identification of the species, the male syntype is herein designated as the lectotype and the female as the paralectotypes . Lectotype with the following labels: / Origin. / Chanchamayo / 555 /
Siculodes cervinalis Pag.
/, and the following labels will be added: / LECTOTYPE / LECTOTYPE
Zeuzerodes ( Siculodes ) cervinalis Pagenstecher, 1892
, Queiroz-Santos, Casagrande & Mielke det. 2020 /. Paralectotype with the following labels: / Origin. / Original / Chanchamayo, Thamm /
Zeuzerodes ( Siculodes ) cervinalis Pg.
/ 14:7 /, and the following labels will be added: / PARALECTOTYPE / PARALECTOTYPE
Zeuzerodes ( Siculodes ) cervinalis Pagenstecher, 1892
, Queiroz-Santos, Casagrande & O. Mielke det. 2020 /.

Natural history . Immature stages and host plant unknown. Based on label data, the species occurs both in forest and cerrado and adults were caught in January, March to June and August to November.
